metaTitle: Jungle Guide for Playing With Me
metaDescription: Short guide to coordinate better with your jungler: ganks, objectives, communication, and macro to close games faster.
heroTitle: How to play with me from the jungle üíö
heroLead: To coordinate better, play with less chaos, and close games faster. My focus: tempo, consistent farming and high-probability plays.
heroNote: Golden rule: if we align waves, vision and tempo, the game becomes simple.
heroMediaAlt: Top-down MOBA map in green tones
styleIntro: This explains why I sometimes say ‚Äúbad timing‚Äù and why it often wins games.
styleCard1Text: I prioritize camps to stay strong and not lose tempo.
styleCard2Text: I avoid coinflip ganks: I look for repeatable, planned windows.
styleCard3Text: If the enemy overextends, lacks vision or misuses resources, I go in.
styleExpectTitle: What you can expect from me
styleExpect1: Coherent paths based on lane states.
styleExpect2: Answer the enemy with information (counterplay or cross-map).
styleExpect3: Call objectives when the context is favorable.
styleExpect4: Help secure vision when my route allows it.
styleAvoidTitle: What usually doesn‚Äôt work when asked
styleAvoid1: Ganks with no CC, no wave, or no info on the enemy jungler.
styleAvoid3: Covering pushes without vision that end in death.
styleAvoid4: Forcing fights on bad timers (I lose tempo and fall behind).
gankTitle: Checklist: when is a gank reasonable?
gankIntro: If most are true, it‚Äôs a playable move. If many are missing, it‚Äôs usually better to set up the next one.
gankItem1: Enough CC or damage to secure something (kill, flash, plates, pressure).
gankItem3: Favorable wave (or neutral) so you don‚Äôt donate two waves.
gankItem4: Info on enemy jungler: seen, inferred by path, or from wards.
gankItem5: Doesn‚Äôt break my route: the gank shouldn‚Äôt cost 2 camps + tempo.
gankItem6: Leads to something concrete: reset, objective, plates, zone control.
gankCalloutTitle: How to ask me for a gank (short message)
gankCalloutCode: ‚ÄúI have CC / wave ok / enemy no flash / jungler seen top ‚Äî you can come in 20s‚Äù
gankCalloutHint: With that info, I decide faster and better.
gankMediaAlt: Lane scene with wards and overextension, MOBA style
objectivesTitle: Objectives: when, how, and what my pings mean
objectivesIntro: An objective isn‚Äôt ‚Äújust because‚Äù; it‚Äôs about context. This avoids flips and speeds up closing.
objectivesWhen1: Real priority in nearby lanes (they move first).
objectivesWhen2: Enemy jungler far, dead or without smite: clean window.
objectivesWhen3: Waves pushed/crashing: the enemy loses if they rotate.
objectivesWhen4: Resources available: smite, key ultimates, important summoners.
objectivesWhen5: Minimum vision: control ward + sweep / entrance info.
objectivesWhenNote: If 2+ are missing, it‚Äôs usually better to farm and prep (vision + waves + timers).
objectivesPingTitle: What it means when I ping an objective
objectivesPing1: I have route/tempo to do it now.
objectivesPing2: I need you to push the wave now.
objectivesPing4: If you can‚Äôt come, ping ‚Äúno‚Äù and I‚Äôll play cross-map.
objectivesPingMini: Best response: one clear ping (yes/no) + push wave.
protocolDuring1: The objective is the objective (no chase)
protocolWarningText: If we‚Äôre not ready and a 5v5 arrives, I prioritize leaving and not flipping.
objectivesMediaAlt: Dragon/Baron area with wards, MOBA style
rolesTitle: How to help me by role
rolesIntro: Split by early/mid/late to keep it actionable and easy to remember.
roleTopEarly1: Manage the wave (freeze/slow) if you want a gank window.
roleTopEarly2: Ward river/tri in time (not when you‚Äôre already being ganked).
roleTopMid1: TP to create numbers at objectives or secure side pressure.
roleTopMid2: If you‚Äôre winning, pressure and move up a step (just showing helps).
roleTopLate1: Side with vision: draw pressure without dying.
roleTopLate2: If 2 come for you, ping and play slow: I‚Äôll take the rest of the map.
roleMidEarly1: Priority for scuttle and river control.
roleMidEarly2: Clear calls about the enemy jungler (timer + direction).
roleMidMid1: Short rotations when I ping: 3 seconds can be enough.
roleMidMid2: Push mid before objectives: mid prio = easy objective.
roleMidLate1: Pick zone control (bushes/ramps) and play around smite.
roleMidLate2: Your presence at entrances makes the enemy hesitate.
roleAdcEarly1: No coinflip 2v2 without info on the enemy jungler.
roleAdcEarly2: If support roams, respect it: your survival = future dragon.
roleAdcMid1: On dragon: safe DPS on objective > chasing kills.
roleAdcMid2: Answer pings with wave: push then rotate.
roleAdcLate1: No solo side without vision. If you die, we lose tempo and objectives.
roleAdcLate2: Play near the team on Baron/Dragon timers.
roleSupportEarly1: Proactive vision by wave; early pinks are gold.
roleSupportEarly2: If you have prio, join deep wards (30s well used).
roleSupportMid1: Roam with intent: sweep/ward when I ping objectives decides the play.
roleSupportMid2: If we can‚Äôt fight, help de-escalate and exit.
roleSupportLate1: Control entrances, peel ADC and CC to cut engages on objective.
roleSupportMediaAlt: Support illustration with vision and wards, MOBA style
closeTitle: How we close the game fast
closeIntro: The idea is to convert advantage into structures and tempo, not endless chasing.
closeRule1: Kills ‚Üí tower, deep vision, or objective.
closeRule2: Reset together after objective or pick.
closeRule3: Before Baron: push mid + vision + pick.
closeFinalText: If we align waves, vision and tempo, plays become easy. Ask me for ‚Äúplayable‚Äù things: with info, with wave, and with real payoff.
closeFinalMuted: I bring order to the map; you bring pressure to your lanes. ü§ù
